title: I'm really surprised such few players read  the patch notes
body: Throughout Gold - Plat I am really surprised so many players don't read the patch notes, I mean patch notes can easily redefine the game for you and your champion. I just think a glance is always good as things can change drastically from patch to patch. I tend to  read them 3 times lol :D

replies.body: Pwyff and Scarizard always make sure that the Patch Notes are enjoyable to read as well. So it isn't just a wall of dull text and you can tell actual people are typing it.
gold plat players arent that good so makes sense
Yes, but their general understanding of the game is quite good.
100% false the players im playing with in diamond 5 still dont know how to play.

Maybe they may be lacking mechanical skill or they may be bad at decision making but they do know I am sure nearly all the champions abilities, matchups, monster timers, item builds, team match ups and little things like orb walking and kiting. They may not know how to implement them well all the time but they certainly do know nearly all the general information of the game.

> im playing with in diamond 5

Also if you could explain how you play with D5 if you're unranked I'd greatly appreciate that, ty

yeah because im posting on my main account Kappa. You kids dont want to hear it because you are worse but sorry truth is these players are reallllllly bad. Wonder why the challengers complain? lcs coach's complain about how the players know nothing? wonder why?
I didn't know being in the top 30% was considered bad.

It is. When at the top .01 % they claim how bad the players still are there's a problem. i went from gold to diamond by listening to an lcs coach talk about the game and give coaching. He says if you take the game somewhat seriously there is no reason you shouldnt be diamond 5 and i saw why. Ive been on winning streak after winning streak because the players play worse than silvers in high plat. 70-65% win rates on all my champions. You guys want to believe you get an accomplishment. Im not just saying this to be an asshole its true the players are not good

Why hide behind a smurf? It discredits everything you say and makes you come off as a pretentious asshole. Also being in the top 30% is not bad. It means you have invested enough time in this game to be in essentially the top 1/4 of everyone playing on your server. That is an accomplishment and not one that can be scoffed at. Players not being good is completely relative. A gold to a bronze is good but a gold to a diamond is bad. However that doesn't negate the fact that they have achieved something that the majority of people that play this game can not do. Also, you are just being an asshole.

who says im hiding? who says i cant get onto my mains boards account from the site log in? top 30%? Also i got high in 2 months I just use common sense and win every game? Here's an analogy that and lcs coach used because its true, You take a piece of poop then you take another piece of poop that has corn in it whats the difference? Nothing. At the end of the day they are both poop. You just want something to feel special about but being gold/plat is nothing special its like getting a c+ on a test sure you did a little bit better but you are not even close to A or A+ level. You are just ignorant and is probably younger and want to feel special. Like my coach former lcs coach says if you take the game somewhat serious there is no reason you shouldnt be atleast diamond 5 (:

It isn't even remotely close to a C+. The mean is usually somewhere between a C+ and a B- 70% is 20 percentiles above that. Meaning they probably are in a B+ range. B+ is pretty universally good. Not as good as the people that get 4.0's or 4.3's but still good. Honestly you are A) trolling or B) a pretentious prick and as such I am not going to be responding to anymore of your posts.
youtube.com/lastshadow9 go to gold 3 verbal lesson you will need it lcs coach for gravity

> who says im hiding? who says i cant get onto my mains boards account from the site log in?

I'm still waiting for this, but let's be honest, it won't happen because it can't happen.

Because if he even HAS a high-elo account, I'm guessing it's banned. 
Toxicity OP.

> [{quoted}](name=King Odarth,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=4zGkT2dm,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-21T21:22:58.227+0000)
>
> Maybe they may be lacking mechanical skill or they may be bad at decision making but they do know I am sure nearly all the champions abilities, matchups, monster timers, item builds, team match ups and little things like orb walking and kiting. They may not know how to implement them well all the time but they certainly do know nearly all the general information of the game.
> 
> Also if you could explain how you play with D5 if you're unranked I'd greatly appreciate that, ty

inb4 "alt account"

Yea i'm seeing these more and more. The more I see them the more I don't believe them. Rarely do I see high elo players posting from low elo accounts. It also never helps their point when they make these claims.
looks like its a rare day go buy a lottery ticket.
normals mmr.

> [{quoted}](name=King Odarth,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=4zGkT2dm,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-21T21:22:58.227+0000)
>
> Maybe they may be lacking mechanical skill or they may be bad at decision making but they do know I am sure nearly all the champions abilities, matchups, monster timers, item builds, team match ups and little things like orb walking and kiting. They may not know how to implement them well all the time but they certainly do know nearly all the general information of the game.
> 
> Also if you could explain how you play with D5 if you're unranked I'd greatly appreciate that, ty

He's right


i was d2 last season and I didn't know how to play. It's really not hard.

Also you have it backwards. Generally if you have good mechanics and positioning and know some very basic teamfighting skills and dont lose lane every game, and positive player and play consistent you can get diamond pretty fast.

Different people have different skillsets. There are gold players with great game knowledge, and gold players with great mechanics, what makes most of them gold is that they don't have both at once.

Source: I'm gold, posting on my main, without feeling the need to hide behind a "smurf".

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=4zGkT2dm,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2015-06-22T10:16:02.747+0000)
>
> Different people have different skillsets. There are gold players with great game knowledge, and gold players with great mechanics, what makes most of them gold is that they don't have both at once.
> 
> Source: I'm gold, posting on my main, without feeling the need to hide behind a "smurf".

hueheuheuheuhehueuheuhue



I can get gold with sona top lane mouse only :^)
who says im hiding? add pallyclark on na just because i dont use my real account doesnt mean anything. would if i could to shut you idiots up
Mate, you're in Gold IV.
then why did i add you on my plat 2 account with diamond mmr? m8?

Why would you post on the boards on your alt smurf?  That doesn't make any sense.

I'm just gonna assume that it's your friend.
lol in low elo its even worse... some one locked in ashe, didn't know about the update, complained about champ being too hard, then left. lol
I remember a Zilean post-rework (seriously, a month after or so) saying "Since when was zilean's Q a skill shot?"
I would have loved to see a Sion Main who never checks the news the day after his rework,
they prolly woulda been excited at first seeing he was the size of a lane turret but gotten mad once they saw he can't just roflstomp super easily anymore.
but "NOOOOOOOOOOOOXUUUS!" makes it all better
I knew a sion main pre-rework and he still won't stop crying cause he can't pull the bullshit he used to.
I read the patch notes, but i know a lot of friends who play strictly for fun. They dont care about patches, nerfs, buffs, or anything like that. They just want to get on the rift and play.
I hate reading them, most of the time it's a change I don't agree with QQ

I love to read the Patch Notes. It's one of my favorite things to do. 

Because... {{champion:121}} **Change.... is goooood.**

Champion/build knowledge, jungle timing and overall decision making are WAY more important than mechanical skill in this game.
When you actually KNOW what you're doing, simple strategies like wombo-combo comps, or camping the enemy jungler in their jungle become amazingly effective.
You don't need a Lee Sin making da plays to win games.

Agreed and...

That moment when you realize the majority of board members don't read patch notes either, then claim everyone is "LCS sheep" when a champion starts seeing play. Its not like patch notes have information on critical changes to LoL, that can drastically change the meta, and champion viability or something...

Moral of the story... read the patch notes!
problem is whenever i read them i just keep doing this https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kxRX6LXDpWs

I barely even play League at all, I have NEVER played a ranked match in my life, and I'm absolutely trash at the game.

I read the patch notes of every patch released for this game. Because I like Riot as a game dev, and like seeing the way they work. They know what the hell they're doing(usually) and if they mess up they fix things fairly quickly. They communicate more than almost any other game dev team, and they actually know how to make their game more fun most of the time.
patch notes that involve gutting my eve over and over don't interest me.

When{{champion:14}} first got reworked:

Enemy killed me in a 1v3 tower dive and all started to spam /laugh 1 hit from death just outside of tower range

Suddenly I come back and smack em all down

{{champion:238}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:64}} "wtf was that, since when can you do that?!"

{{champion:14}} MY NEW PASSIVE MWAHAHAHAHAHA

I had 2 persons in an aram last week yelling at an Ezreal in our team that EZ doesn't have any AD scaling on his ult so he was being useless in aram not going ap. There were die hard I don't read patch notes type of people.
I love reading patch notes.

I always look at patch notes. I sometimes even like to see what pro/former-pro players see about some of the changed by watching for someone like saint go over them. I do this and i'm silver 5, like god damn people.
I reread most sections that involve the champs I play

Yeah... A couple weeks ago, as a {{champion:16}} , an {{champion:103}}  ask me to give her mana in ARAM. I response "it has been remove ages ago", she got all quiet quicker than a cheetah, people really need to pay attention. They don't even have to read the technical stuff, at least look at the major change, just watch people will get all idiotic again when the Magus Enchantment {{item:3708}} change to Runeglaive next patch.
did anybody else not notice the added turret to tt?  I got in a game with my bro and bro in law and freaked out.
I love reading patch notes too ^^, cant believe people dont read them not sure how you would know though :S

> not sure how you would know though :S

I can tell when they don't know some of the major highlights of the patch or I just ask them and they say no

I find it sad that players who are involved in the competitive aspect of league don't all at least look over champion and item changes. I'm unranked (and have no intention of playing ranked any time soon) and i always read the patch notes before playing on the newest patch.

Fiora: hasn't been in the Notes since 4.20 and only a few itemization changes where she can be built so I can still rape enemy teams with my main, couple that with knowledge of your enemies abilities and then you have a monster
